title: 820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
message:
Client tried remove battery with installed logic board and he damaged U6550 (it is cracked).
No sound, no audio devices in system settings.
Removed that IC and found fried pad 23 but it has still connection with path.
Still no audio and not visible audio device in settings.

Will try with new IC but waiting for delivery.

Left fan is running on max rpm all the time.
Checked temp sensors in iStat menus and all looks OK (it is linked with speaker amp.

Is there any think what I can do before new speaker amp IC will arrive?

Thanks

title: 820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
message:
The speaker amps connect directly with audio codec U6200; it may be damaged now.
Check resistors between PCH and audio codec.
Also check power rails of U6200.

title: 820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
message:
1.8V power rail going in U6200.
Resistors between PCH and audio codec R6203, R1310-13 are OK.

That speaker amp which was cracked had burned out pad. That line is  AUD_SPKRAMP_INT_L and as you said it is connected directly with U6200. On that path there is R6291 which on one side it has PP1V8_S0 and resistance should be 47K but it is only 1.6K.

Checked rest of resistors around U6200 and here is what is not right:
R6227 should be 1.5K but it is 69Ohm

title: 820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
message: Compare diode mode to ground readings between SCL/SDA lines.

title: 820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
message: Remove R6229 and check again, over C6288/89 pads.

title: 820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
message:
Then the problem comes from U6300, or U6500/50.
Remove them (one by one) and check when  AUD_I2C_1B_SCL goes high; in diode mode to ground.

title: 820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
message:
U6500 removed (U6550 was cracked at the start so it was removed at the begging) and AUD_I2C_1B_SCL got 0.340V in diode mode :)
Fitted R6229 back in place and audio device visible in settings and sound works on one channel :)
Waiting for delivery with speaker amp ICs.

Still left fan runs at max RPMs all the time - iStat temp sensors show all correct temps - any idea with that one?

title: 820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
message:
Did you try another fan?
Compare diode mode readings between Q6000/50 areas.

title: 820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
message:
Diode mode between Q6000/50 areas are the same and resitors around Q6000/50 areas got the same resistance.
With new fan and new keyboard flex same issue.

edit: I just swapped logic board from another one and one fan is still on max rpms so all looks like some issue with keyboard/palmrest.

title: 820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
message:
Tried with good known trackpad and flex cable and same issue.
Swapped logic board to another machine and fan speed is working fine so on 99.9% keyboard/palmrest is faulty.

title: 820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
message: The fan controller is placed on the keyboard .

title: 820-00281 no sound - speaker amp IC cracked
message:
Speaker amps replaced, palmrest replaced and all working fine.

Many thank for help :)
